subject: Writing
title: Citizen Kane: The Script That Changed Cinema
description: A quick win: understand Citizen Kane: The Script That Changed Cinema.

hook.text: Two men claimed credit for the greatest screenplay ever written. The argument lasted 60 years.

buildup.text: Citizen Kane's screenplay was credited to both Herman Mankiewicz and Orson Welles when it won the 1942 Oscar.

discovery.text: Mankiewicz wrote most of the first draft while recovering from a broken leg â€” isolated, focused, and brilliant.

twist.text: Welles rewrote extensively, restructured the story, and added the non-linear timeline that made the film revolutionary.

climax.text: The debate over credit revealed how collaborative screenwriting truly is â€” great scripts rarely have a single author.

punchline.text: Cinema's greatest script was born from a fight over credit.

quiz.question: Who co-wrote the screenplay for Citizen Kane?
